name.description: The name of this DC/OS service.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to GitLab.

role.description: Deploy GitLab only on nodes with this role.

routing.description: GitLab routing properties for use with Marathon-lb.

https-redirect.description: Whether Marathon-lb should redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This requires 'virtual-host' to be set. By default, this is false.

virtual-host.description: The virtual host address to configure for integration with Marathon-lb.

ssh-port.description: The port that ssh clients will connect to against the virtual-host.

enabled.description: Whether to use external SMTP email server. By default, this is false.

port.description: Port to access the SMTP server on

username.description: If your mail server requires authentication, set the username in this setting.

password.description: If your mail server requires authentication, set the password in this setting.

authentication.description: If your mail server requires authentication, you need to specify the authentication type here. ('plain', 'login', 'cram_md5')

enable-starttls-auto.description: Detects if STARTTLS is enabled in your SMTP server and starts to use it. Defaults to true.

openssl-verify-mode.description: When using TLS, you can set how OpenSSL checks the certificate. ('none', 'peer', 'client_once', 'fail_if_no_peer_cert')

tls.description: Enables the SMTP connection to use SMTP/TLS. Default to false.

email-from-address.description: From Address used in email headers

high-availability.description: GitLab high availability properties. If enabled, single-node properties WILL NOT be used.

enabled.description: Whether to use external Postgres and Redis servers to enable a highly available deployment of GitLab. By default, this is false.

host-volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting GitLab configuration and data. This directory MUST be mounted on all DC/OS agents.

single-node.description: Configuration related to running a single instance version of GitLab. If high availability is enabled, these settings will be ignored.

persistent-volumes.description: Persistent volumes configuration (only used if external volumes are disabled). Persistent volumes are created on one machine and Marathon will attempt to re-launch the task on the same machine. Note that if the machine is lost, your data may also be lost.

config-size.description: Size of the configuration volume in MiB.

data-size.description: Size of data volume in MiB.

external-volumes.description: External volumes configuration. External volumes are a DC/OS feature that allow your data to be migrated with your task.

enabled.description: Whether to use DC/OS external volumes to persist GitLab state. By default, this is false.

enterprise.description: Optionally check to install Enterprise Edition. (For use if you have a license file from GitLab Inc)

enterprise-edition.description: Whether to deploy the EE edition of the software. Defaults to false.
